peopleAlsoAsk.question: Where can I get a painting valued for free?
peopleAlsoAsk.snippet: Halls offers free online valuations of antique and fine art items, including jewellery, watches, paintings, and collectibles. Our experienced valuers can provide an initial estimate of an item's value based on a simple description and photographs.
peopleAlsoAsk.title: Request a Free Valuation - Halls Fine Art

peopleAlsoAsk.question: How can I get art appraised for free?
peopleAlsoAsk.snippet: Free "appraisals" are a great option depending on your intended use of the information. Auction houses are the most common place that offer free "appraisals". Understanding why the appraisal is free is the key to knowing how to use the information. An auction house offers free "appraisals"
peopleAlsoAsk.title: Are Free Art Appraisals Good? - YouTube

peopleAlsoAsk.question: How much does an art appraisal cost?
peopleAlsoAsk.snippet: Art appraisers may adjust their hourly rate depending on the scope of the appraisal assignment, but on average you should expect to pay between $150-$500 per hour for a USPAP-compliant art appraisal.
peopleAlsoAsk.title: How much does it cost to get art appraised?

peopleAlsoAsk.question: Is free art appraiser legit?
peopleAlsoAsk.snippet: In reality, the free appraisals given by auction houses are not real art appraisals at all. They are only quick estimations of what they think your art will fetch at the hammer. Except for the few major world auction houses with good trained art appraisals, most auctions houses will have little experienced experts.
peopleAlsoAsk.title: Free art appraisals not so free after all - VWART.com
